content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I used the "google" command to search for the best attractions, activities, and accommodations in Boston, Porto, and Switzerland. I received a list of URLs, including some related to the Brno Reservoir trail in Czechia. I used the "browse_website" command to find information on the Brno Reservoir trail, and found that it is not a loop around the entire reservoir, but there are sections of waterfront path or roadside sidewalk. I executed a Python file and installed the necessary packages to gather more information on the trail. I then used the "web_search" command to search for more information on the Brno Reservoir trail and found several websites with details about the trail. I used the "execute_python_file" command to run the "brno_reservoir_trail.py" file, which returned an error. I then used the "google" command to search for more information on the trail and found several websites with details about the trail.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "execute_shell", "args": {"command_line": "pip install beautifulsoup4"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command execute_shell returned: STDOUT:\nb\'Requirement already satisfied: beautifulsoup4 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (4.12.2)\\nRequirement already satisfied: soupsieve>1.2 in /usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages (from beautifulsoup4) (2.4.1)\\n\'\nSTDERR:\nb"WARNING: Running pip as the \'root\' user can result in broken permissions and conflicting behaviour with the system package manager. It is recommended to use a virtual environment instead: https://pip.pypa.io/warnings/venv\\n\\n[notice] A new release of pip is available: 23.0.1 -> 23.1.2\\n[notice] To update, run: pip install --upgrade pip\\n"', type='action_result')]
"""
